referable-content.title: [RC:steps] Assigning a new host node for TiS 16
referable-content.shortdesc: You can use controller-0 to assign a configuration or personality (controller, compute, or storage, for example) to a new node.

context.p: You can assign one of the following personalities.

prereq.p: Before initializing a node, ensure that the following conditions are satisfied:

li.p: The node must meet the hardware requirements for the personality to be assigned. RC XREF: Updated to live link. We don't recommend xrefs in referable content topics so consider removing.For more information, see Titanium Server Planning:

note.p: CGTS-4159 added caution re SW RAIDSoftware RAID is not supported.

li.p: Controller-0 must be installed and configured.
The node must be connected to the internal management network or PXE boot network using an Ethernet interface configured for PXE boot.
The node must be connected to the internal management network using the PXE boot network.
The node must be configured in the BIOS to boot from the internal management network or PXE boot network.
The node must be configured in the BIOS to boot from the PXE boot network.

step.cmd: Add the host to the system inventory.

note.p: The host must be added to the system inventory before it is powered on.

info.p: On controller-0, acquire Keystone administrative privileges:

US62814, US62816 update host-add parameters; CGTS-4254 clarify when hostname is used. US63466 adds -DUse the system host-add command to add a host and specify its personality. You can also specify the device used to display messages during boot.

note.p: The hostname parameter is required for compute hosts. For controller and storage hosts, it is ignored.

codeblock.userinput: system host-add -p personality -n hostname \ [-l location] [-o install_output[-c console]] [-b boot_device] \ [-r rootfs_device] [-m mgmt_mac] [-i mgmt_ip] [-D ttys_dcd] \ [-T bm_type -M bm_mac -I bm_ip -U bm_username -P bm_password]

info.p: where

pd.p: is a name to assign to the host (used for compute nodes only).
is the host type (controller or compute).
is the host type (controller, storage, or compute).
is a string describing the location of the host.
is the output device to use for message display on the host (for example, tty0). The default is ttys0, 115200.
is the format for console output on the host (text or graphical). The default is text.
is the host device for boot partition, relative to /dev. The default is sda.
is the host device for rootfs partition, relative to /dev. The default is sda.
is the MAC address of the port connected to the internal management or PXE boot network.

is the IP address of the port connected to the internal management or PXE boot network, if static IP address allocation is used.
The mgmt_ip option is not used for a controller node.

is set to True to have any active console session automatically logged out when the serial console cable is disconnected, or False to disable this behavior. The server must support data carrier detect on the serial console port.
is the board management controller type (iLO3, iOL4 or Quanta).
is the board management controller MAC address.
is the board management controller IP address.
is the user name for board management controller access.
is the password for board management controller access.

info.p: To ensure you can correctly identify hosts as you install them, power on and configure each new node one at a time. With controller-0 running, start the host.
US63465 branding removed from screenThe host boots from the network and then displays a message that it is waiting to be configured.

US63465 branding removed from screenThe node is assigned the personality specified in the system host-add parameters. A display-device menu appears on the console, with text customized for the personality (Controller, Storage, or Compute Node).
Titanium Server Controller Node Install
You can start the installation manually by pressing Enter. Otherwise, it is started automatically after a few seconds.
The active controller assigns an id when the host is detected. To update the host with a personality from the command line, the id is required.
The id is shown in the first field of the system host-list command output:
This example shows the output when the first host is powered on after controller-0 has been configured.

stepresult.p: Controller-0 configures the required parameters and displays them as illustrated above. The host is still reported as offline, because the Titanium Server software has yet to be installed in its hard drive.

US63465 branding removed from screenController-0 automatically pushes the Titanium Server installer image over the network for the host to boot. The console of the host displays the Titanium Server welcome screen.

step.cmd: Open the Edit Host dialog box to begin provisioning the new host.

substep.cmd: Display the available hosts in the system.

info.p: Select Admin Platform Host Inventory , and then select the Hosts tab.
US77470 update for new UnProvisioned Hosts list.The new node is listed in the UnProvisioned Hosts list.

substep.cmd: Click Edit Host for the new host.
On the Host Info tab, select the Personality for the new node.

step.cmd: Assign a personality to the host.

info.p: Select from the Personality drop-down menu. You can assign one of the following personalities:
The Edit Host dialog box is updated with different fields for the selected personality.

step.cmd: Set the installation parameters for the node.

note.p: If the host uses any console port other than ttys0 for output display, you must change settings on the Installation Parameters tab to ensure that the host uses the correct port.

info.p: On the Host Info tab:

li.p: Type a physical Location for the node to help identify it.
US63466 adds Specify whether to enable Serial Console Data Carrier Detect.
Select this option to have any active console session automatically logged out when the serial console cable is disconnected. The server must support data carrier detect on the serial console port.

info.p: On the Installation Parameters tab:

dd.p: is the host device for boot partition, relative to /dev. The default is sda.
is the host device for rootfs partition, relative to /dev. The default is sda.
is the format for console output on the host (text or graphical). The default is text.

note.p: If using graphical, you must clear the Console field, or change it to specify the port for graphical output. If you clear the field, tty0 is used.

dd.p: is the output device to use for message display on the host (for example, tty0). The default is ttys0, 115200. Note that this is not updated to reflect changes to the Installation Output setting.

substep.cmd: Click Save to initialize and configure the new node.

stepresult.p: US63465 branding removed from screenThe node is restarted automatically, and a display-device menu appears on the node console.

substep.cmd: Wait while the node is configured and rebooted.

info.p: Up to 20 minutes can be required for a reboot. When the reboot is complete, the node is reported as Locked, Disabled, and Online.

note.p: To ensure a successful installation, wait for the node to be reported as Locked, Disabled, and Online, and ensure that the login prompt appears on the host console. If the process is interrupted prematurely, the host installation can fail.

stepresult.p: On the host console, a login screen is displayed.

note.p: You must change your password immediately. To begin, provide the default password wrsroot. Next, type a new password and confirm it.

stepresult.p: The host is now configured with a personality.

postreq.p: Before you can unlock a host, you must configure its network interfaces and storage resources.

result.p: The new host is initialized with an operating system, rebooted, and configured with the assigned personality.
